attributes.action: Create a Fair Two-Stage ILR Model for Skilled Workers
attributes.additional_details: This approach is vital for preventing exploitation. Remaining tied to employer sponsorship for 10–15 years puts workers at serious risk, especially in sectors such as social care, where dependence on a sponsor can lead to unfair treatment. A two-stage ILR system would remove this vulnerability by allowing workers to leave restrictive sponsorship arrangements after three or five years, without granting immediate access to public funds.
attributes.background: Create a two-stage ILR model: an initial form of ILR that continues the “no recourse to public funds” restriction, followed later by full ILR.

rejection.details:
Your submitted petition appears to be calling for two separate things on which there are already petitions open, which you may wish to sign:

Retain 5 Year ILR & Citizenship Route, Delay Public Funds Access Until Year 10
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/731835

Allow Displaced Care Workers to work temporarily without a new sponsorship
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/730717
